111.content:
Makoto was still recovering from the death of Sayaka and the brutal execution of Leon. However, he made sure to keep positive. He needed to stay hopeful.

As he began to head to the dining hall for breakfast, he heard the now familiar chime of a school bell and the voice of Monokuma "attention students. Come down to the gym for a beary special announcement"

Makoto knew that he had no choice but to listen, he saw the rest of the students leave the dining hall and begin to head to the gym, none of them seemed to be looking forward to this, any announcement from Monokuma was bound to be a bad one.

When they all arrived in the Gym, Monokuma was waiting for them all "Ah! You're all here!" The robot bear said happily. "You haven't been killing each other nearly fast enough, so I prepared a new motive for you!"

Everyone got a nervous look on their faces, the last motive they had been given could easily force anyone into committing murder. They all braced themselves for the worst.

"You will all.....swap bodies with each other!" Monokuma said with a laugh, but everyone was silent. Not the reaction he was expecting "well, aren't you all surprised?" He asked, wanting some kind of response.

"Is this some kind of joke?" Togami was the first one to speak up, clearly annoyed

"Yeah!" Aoi spoke up after him "Something like that is completely impossible!"

"Khufufufufu" Monokuma chuckled. "Or is it? Bam!" He shouted and suddenly everyone was blinded by a bright light. When it cleared, nothing appeared to have changed. Until they heard a girlish squeal......coming from Togami

"What dis you do to me?!' Togami's body asked, looking down at itself in shock

Aoi's body on the other hand stayed calm as the current occupant assessed the situation "How were you able to do this?" Togami asked, Aoi's voice sounding extremely strange with his harsh tone

"Hooooow? Who knows. Maybe it was maaagic, maybe I got a scientific remote in the mail, maaaaybe I was born with this ability. Who cares about the how! What matters is that it happened to you two, and is about to happen to all of you! Hahaha!" Monokuma laughed

"But wait, how would this get us to kill each other?" Makoto asked, not fully understanding the motive

"Whyyyyyy? Man, you haven't really thought ahead, have You? For 1 thing, if you kill someone while in another body, the class will have to vote for the mind that did it, not the body. So if you keep who you really are a secret...."

"It will be even harder to find the blackened!" Makoto finished Monokuma's sentence

"Well That's simple, we'll just have to announce what bodies we're in after we switch!" Ishimaru shouted out a possible solution

"Kuhuhuhu" Monokuma giggled again. "Are you suuuuure that all of you would do that? What if one of you beefier people ended up in the body of weak little Chihiro, would you want to announce that to potential killers looking to get rid of you? What if someone really likes your body and wants to stay in it, would you want to tell them what body you're currently in so they can kill you and keep you from going back?" Monokuma began to say reasons for them to not tell anyone why bodies they're in, hoping to depress everyone.

"Hey! No fair! You already got me and Byakuya to say we were swapped by swapping us first!" Aoi said from Togami's body

"Don't worry, I'll shuffle you two back around too!" Monokuma said before another bright light engulfed the class.

When the light cleared, Makoto could already tell that things were different. He was standing in a completely different area of the gym and his whole body felt different. He looked down to see he was in the body of.....

1111.content:
Makoto first noticed that his hands were covered in tight, leather gloves, and silverish strands of hair hung from his head, which narrowed down whose body he'd ended up by a lot. He did a quick check over himself, and seeing that he was wearing a dark, purple coat, boots, and most uncomfortably, a skirt, he confirmed that he was indeed in Kyoko's body.

He glanced around, trying to ignore the awkwardness he felt in his new body, and saw that everyone else in the room was doing the same as him, inspecting themselves all over and looking around in confusion. He even spotted his own body, staring at its hands with an indignant expression on its face. He was about to approach it to find out who was in it before a harsh voice spoke out from the crowd.

"Everyone, calm down and listen up!" Celeste's body gave a shout which sounded out of place coming in her voice. "I am Kiyotaka Ishimaru, the Ultimate Moral Compass. I reccommend everyone else in this room identify themselves one by one!"

"And what if we don't?" Hifumi, or whoever was in his body, asked with a raised eyebrow.

"If you don't, then...well..." Taka seemed to be struggling to find a good reason.

"Then not only will you be a top suspect if another murder occurs, you'll also be deemed untrustworthy by the rest of us who do decide to reveal our true identites," Byakuya's body said, crossing its arms. "I'm Kyoko Kirigi, just to be clear."

"That would imply I would ever want to spend time with any of you," 'Hifumi' replied sharply, before turning and trudging out of the Gym without another word.

"I'm guessing that was the real Byakuya," Hina's body said. "I'm Yasuhiro, by the way."

"So, Hiro is in my body," Chihiro's voice came from behind him, presumably the real Asahina. "Well, at least I know who is."

"And I'm Makoto Naegi," Makoto finally spoke up, somewhat nervously. He spared a glance over at Kyoko, who was giving him an odd look from behind Byakuya's glasses that he couldn't quite put his finger on.

"Well...I'm Chihiro Fujisaki," Chihiro said weakly from Sakura's large frame. It was a surprise to see Sakura acting so timidly

"Alright, alright!" Monokuma exclaimed. The ultimate students spun around to face him; in the confusion, most had forgotten he was even there. "That's enough chit-chat for now. You can all catch up after you leave the Gym. See you soon, and don't forget to make the most of your new bodies!"

With that, he left them, cackling as he disappeared behind the desk. The students began to file out of the hall, most going their separate ways.

"Darn." Makoto heard Taka scowl. "Now we won't be able to get everyone to distinguish themselves!"

It seemed like the only way to find out who everyone else had become was to approach those who hadn't revealed themselves yet, and Makoto realised now was the perfect chance for him to do so. But, he could also spend time with someone who had identified themselves, and he would at least know who he was speaking to that way.

What should he do?

111111.content:
Makoto decided that the most important thing at the moment was discovering who was occupying his own body. After leaving the gym, he set off to search for his body. Being forced to walk around in Kyoko's body was uncomfortable, to say the least. He had to deal with hair getting in his face every time he moved his head, as well as the awkward feeling he got moving around in a skirt.

However, this trek around the school was giving him an opportunity to get used to his new form, which was a necessity since Monokuma likely wouldn't switch everyone back until after the class trial. After a bit of searching, Makoto finally found his own body in the dining hall drinking some tea. The person in his body immediately heard the sound of the boots Kyoko's body was wearing hit the ground as he entered, and turned to face him.

"Hmm? Oh, hey Kyoko!" Makoto's body greeted him with a smile.

"Um, I'm Makoto, remember? I'm just in Kyoko's body..." Makoto felt embarrassed to be mistaken for Kyoko, but supposed he had to get used to it.

"Haha! Of course I know that! I mean, how could I forget? I'm in your body after all!"

"Oh, heh, right... So, um, anyway... Who are you?" Makoto's speech was a bit delayed as he still wasn't used to hearing Kyoko's feminine voice coming out of "his" mouth.

"Who? What do you mean? I'm Makoto Naegi of course!" Once again, his body flashed a bright smile.

"That's not really what I meant. I wanted to know who you were originally."

"Hmm... I don't know!"

"Stop joking around, this is serious!" Makoto was starting to feel oddly annoyed at the happy smile on his body's face.

"Too bad, I'm not telling!" His body turned away from Makoto and continued sipping the tea.

The only people left unrevealed were Hifumi, Celeste, Sakura, Toko, and Mondo. Makoto was getting a feeling that whoever was in his body was trying really hard to act like him, meaning they didn't want to reveal their identity. Honestly, he thought that any of them could be capable of that if they put their mind to it, so he couldn't eliminate anyone just from that. The only person that he was fairly certain *could* was eliminated is Toko, since he doubted she could just overcome her usual stutter like that.

Makoto didn't really have enough evidence to conclusively say who was in his body, nor was that person willing to tell him anything. Makoto wasn't sure whether to just let it go for now or to keep questioning his body for answers.

What should Makoto do?

111121.content:
Makoto couldn't help but feel a little lost as he paced through the halls of the school. So many things that had seemed unbelievable had happened while he was here at Hope's Peak Academy, but this had to be at the top of the list. Every step reminded him that he was no longer himself, with how different Kyoko's body was from his own. He wanted to believe this was just a dream, that there was no way something like this could actually happen, but it all felt far too real for that.

Though he felt somewhat uneasy about the fact that he didn't know who everyone currently was, thanks to Monokuma forcing them out before everyone could reveal themselves, there was something else he was curious about. While he, and many others, didn't know who was in their body, thanks to him revealing himself, Kyoko knew exactly who was in her's. He couldn't help but wonder how she felt about him being in her body. Hina also knew who was in hers, but her only reaction seemed to be that she was glad to know who it was. On the other hand, when he'd revealed himself, Kyoko had just given him an odd look from across the room. What exactly was she thinking?

As luck would have it, Makoto just so happened to run into Kyoko outside the dorm rooms. She appeared to be speaking with whoever was in Toko's body, but he didn't get a chance to hear what was being said before "Toko" retreated back into her room. Kyoko appeared to be deep in though as Makoto approached, and though he didn't really want to interrupt her train of thought, he did still want to talk to her.

"Uh, hey Kyoko," Makoto greeted. It felt strange to hear Kyoko's voice coming out of his mouth, but he supposed it was something he'd need to get used to for the time being.

Glancing up at him, Kyoko gave a look at appeared only slightly friendlier than the real Byakuya. "Makoto," she responded with a nod. "Did you need something?"

"I just, y'know, wanted to talk... if that's okay?"

"Hm. If you insist."

Makoto was finding it incredibly difficult to ready Kyoko's emotions. Despite what he wanted to ask her, he decided it might be better to make a little small talk first. "So, who was that you were talking to?"

"...I don't know."

"Huh?"

"I have some ideas about who they might be, but not enough to say for certain. In fact, I've yet to discern who anyone else is other than those who revealed themselves in the gym."

"You mean, they're hiding who they really are?" While Byakuya hadn't admitted who he really was, although it was still fairly obvious, Makoto had thought that everyone else was only unknown because of Monokuma ushering them out. Were some of the others really going to keep their identity a secret?

"Indeed. Whoever it was just now wasn't acting like Toko, but they weren't admitting who they were either. It seems some people have taken Monokuma's words to heart."

"No!" Makoto let out, almost involuntarily. It couldn't be true. They weren't really hiding their identity to make it harder to find them when they killed, were they? They must have some other reason for it.

Kyoko frowned, likely at they way Makoto was acting. "Was there anything else you wanted to ask me?"

Makoto did his best to calm down. He supposed now was as good a time as any to ask Kyoko what she thought about all this. "Well, um... I was just wondering, how you felt about... y'know."

It was somewhat awkward to say, but Kyoko didn't mince words. "How I feel about you being in my body?"

"Uh, yeah."

Kyoko gave pause, seemingly considering what the best way to respond would be. "Well, admittedly, it's somewhat strange seeing my body so... emotive, and unsure of itself. At the very least, you're fairly harmless."

"Huh? What's that supposed to mean?"

"I don't expect you of all people to be committing murder in my body, and you seem too timid to violate my privacy any more than Monokuma has already forced you to."

"Wha-?! I-I..." Makoto's face went as red as a tomato. He hadn't even really considered that side of being inside someone else's body. He was suddenly feeling much more anxious about not knowing who was in his body, and what they might be doing with it.

Kyoko let out a small smirk. Makoto's reaction was somewhat amusing, even if it was coming from her own body. "While I would have preferred one of the girls be in my body, I suspect I have nothing to worry about from you. Just..." Kyoko hesitated for a moment, as if wondering whether she should even bring up what she was about to say, but ultimately, she followed through. "Don't take off my gloves. I'd rather people not see what's underneath them, and that includes you."

"Okay, I promise." Admittedly, Makoto was a little curious about what lay underneath them now that she'd brought it up, but he respected her wishes. The gloves would stay on.

"Thank you. Now, is that all?"

"Uh, yeah, I guess." While there was more he probably could have asked, Kyoko seemed somewhat busy, so he decided it could wait until later.

"Very well. I'll see you around, then."

"See you," Makoto mumbled as Kyoko begun to walk off, most likely heading off to try and figure out who everyone was. It had been a bit weird conversing with Kyoko about this, with Kyoko looking like Byakuya and Kyoko's voice coming out of his own mouth, but he could only imagine how much stranger it must have been for Kyoko herself. The idea of conversing with his own body while someone else was inside of it seemed incredibly strange to him, and yet, he'd just made Kyoko go through with it. At the very least, she didn't seem to take issue with him being in her body, not that she had much of a say in it.

Feeling a little exhausted from the events of the morning, Makoto decided to return to his room to rest for a bit. There was still much to do, and so many people who's identities were still a mystery, but he needed a break for now. He reached into his pocket to pull out his room key, only to realise his mistake. He wasn't in his own body, he was in Kyoko's and her skirt lacked the pockets his own pants had had. After a little searching, he managed to find a room key inside Kyoko's jacket, but naturally, it was for Kyoko's room rather than his own.

Makoto knew he'd need to go in there eventually, considering they were only allowed to sleep in the dorm rooms, and this was the only room key he owned now, but that didn't stop it from feeling like an invasion of privacy. What if there was something in her room she didn't want people seeing, but hadn't had a chance to hide it away before everyone swapped? Perhaps it would be better to leave it for now. He could have a look and see who else was around to talk to. There was still time left in the day, and although putting it off might not make it less awkward, at the very least, he could avoid it until it was necessary.

11112111.content:
"Hey, Makoto!"

Hearing Mondo's voice from behind, Makoto turned to face him. The person currently inhabiting Mondo's body never revealed their identity in the gym, so he figured now would be a good opportunity to gain some info.

"Oh, hey...um...could you tell me who you are so I can call you by name?"

"H-huh?! You want to know who I am?! I'm sorry, but I c-can't do that!"

Makoto recognized that stutter. There was only one person that came to mind.

"You're...Toko, right?" Mondo's body instinctively shot up in surprise.

"N-no! How'd you find out?! W-wait, I mean, I'm not T-Toko, I'm uh..."

Toko was obviously trying to hide her identity, but why? Could she seriously be planning to kill someone in Mondo's body? There was no way that could be what she was planning, but that was the only thing that Makoto could think of.

"Toko, I know it's you. Why are you trying to hide it? You aren't trying to do what Monokuma said, are you?"

For a second, Makoto felt a bit of doubt, but immediately shook it off. After all, there's no way someone as shy as Toko could be planning something so sinister, right?

"Ugh...fine, it's me. I'm Toko Fukawa. B-but don't tell anyone, got that?! It's not like I plan on murdering someone, but...she might."

Toko muttered the last few words under her breath, causing Makoto to miss the end of what she said. However, he had heard what he wanted to hear. Toko wasn't planning murder. Whatever her reasons for hiding it were, Makoto felt he could trust her. However, he was now faced with a dilemma. Should he let Kyoko know that he figured out which body Toko was in, or should he respect Toko's wish to keep it a secret?

He looked around and saw that everyone else was similarly panicking and examining their new bodies. Some of them were trying to calm everyone down, but with no success.

Everyone complied with what Kyoko said and most left the gym. Leaving only Makoto in Celeste'a body, Kiyotaka in Toko's body, Aoi in Mondo's body, Yasohiro in Byakuya's body, and Kyoko in Hifumi's body.

11121.content:
"Why'd you chase everyone off? Now how are we supposed get everyone to confess who they really are?" Taka asked as he got down from the stage and headed over to where those remaining were standing.

"I'm sure if they were going to confess, they would have done it already," Hiro said dismissively.

"Hiro's right. If anyone was planning on admitting to who they really are, then they would have done so instead of leaving. This isn't exactly something we can force them to admit," Kyoko stated, still as calm and composed as ever, despite the circumstances. Makoto thought it was a bit strange to see Hifumi's body acting so serious, but then, none of them were really acting like who they appeared to be.

"So, what do we do now, then?" Makoto asked. Kyoko had asked everyone who hadn't stated their identity to leave, but he wasn't really sure how they could progress from here.

"Well, obviously our first priority should be getting used to the bodies we're currently in, seeing as we'll be stuck like this until at least the next class trial."

"Wait, what do mean "at least"?" Hina interrupted.

"Monokuma is using this body swap as the motive for the next murder, but he never said he'd swap us back once it was all over."

"You really think he'd just leave us all like this?" Taka asked. Despite him speaking with Toko's voice, her trademark stutter was nowhere to be found.

"After everything else he's put us through, it wouldn't surprise me," Makoto mumbled, fidgeting a little awkwardly. He wasn't exactly comfortable being in Celeste's body, seeing as he was a boy and she was a girl, but he supposed the others must all be going through something similar too. Even those who'd ended up in the body of someone the same gender as them, like Hiro, would still have differences between their usual body and the one Monokuma had put them in.

"Anyway," Kyoko said, trying to steer the conversation back on track. "Regardless of how long Monokuma decides to keep us like this, it's particularly important for us that we get used to this quickly. As much as I'm sure we'd love to think that another murder won't occur, I think the fact that over half of us didn't reveal our identity is enough to show that it's a definite possibility."

Kyoko's words seemed to put everyone on edge, as if their circumstances hadn't done that already. After everything that had happened, Makoto wanted to stay positive, he wanted to believe that they'd all work together to try and get out of here, but Kyoko's words did ring true. If people didn't divulge their identity, it would make it more difficult to find the culprit if a murder occurred, so that fact that so many chose to hide who they were made him uneasy.

Despite the group's unrest, Kyoko continued. "And, if someone does decide to murder, we may be a larger target than anyone else."

"Because of what Monokuma said, right?" Hina asked. "If someone likes our body, they might come after us so they can keep it."

"Exactly."

"So, we've just gotta get used to these bodies and keep an eye on our old selves. Doesn't sound too bad," Hiro said, seemingly taking this the best of group, in line with his laid-back attitude.

"Easy for you to say," Hina grumbled. "You got swapped with Byakuya."

"Well you got swapped with him too."

"Yeah, but I'm a girl. You and Byakuya are both boys. It'd be different if I swapped with Sakura or something."

"Um, I have a question," Makoto said, interrupting the ensuing argument. "What are we supposed to do about our rooms?"

"Huh?"

"I mean, are we supposed to stay in our old rooms, or the rooms of who's bodies we're in now?"

Kyoko was the one to answer. "I don't think it'll be possible to stay in our own rooms. You need a key to enter the dorm rooms, but the key to your room will be with whoever has your body now."

"R-Right." Makoto hadn't really thought about all this from that angle. This wasn't just a matter of him being in someone else's body; someone else was currently walking around in his. Someone who refused to say who they were, for that matter. It was almost more unnerving than being in someone else's body himself. Almost. "So then, we probably have the key to the room of whoever's body we're in."

Almost immediately, the group began checking to make sure they did in fact have the key they needed. In Makoto's case, it took a while to locate, due to the lack of obvious pockets on Celeste's outfit. He eventually located it inside her jacket, alongside her e-Handbook. The others seemed to have found their's as well. Just as Kyoko had said, they all had the keys of the bodies they were stuck in.

"Alright, so it looks like we'll be staying in the room of whoever's body we're in," Taka said, trying to take charge of the discussion again. "Now, is there anything else that needs to be discussed before we rejoin the rest of the group?"

1112122.content:
Makoto decided his time would be better spent spending time with someone who hadn't revealed their identity yet. If he spoke to them for a bit, he might be able to figure out who they really were, like he had with Byakuya, which would be useful moving forward if they decided not to reveal it themselves.

Five out of the twelve students had revealed who they were already, namely himself, Taka, Hiro, Kyoko, and Hina. Along with that, he'd managed to figure out that Byakuya was in Chihiro's body, even if he didn't want to reveal himself to the group. That left six students still unaccounted for; Toko, Sakura, Mondo, Hifumi, Chihiro, and Celeste. The six of them were in the bodies of Taka, Hiro, Kyoko, Hina, Sakura, and himself, although he didn't yet know who was who. He'd initially considered that it might have just been one-to-one swaps, like Monokuma had done to Byakuya and Hina in his demonstration, but considering Byakuya was in Chihiro's body instead of Hiro's, that theory proved to be false.

Makoto wondered whether he was really cut out for this task or not. Sure, he'd managed to figure out who Byakuya was, but he didn't seem to be putting in too much of an effort to hide his usual attitude. Although, considering his reasons for not revealing himself, perhaps he was simply lowering his guard around Makoto, and would hide it better in front of the others. For the others, though, he had no idea why they'd choose not to reveal themselves. Were they also afraid of becoming a target? Did they like their current body better than their old one? 1112122112.content:
Looking at the clock, Makoto saw there were only a few minutes left until night time. Not enough time to talk to anyone else, if we was to abide by their self-imposed curfew. A lot of time in the day had been wasted just wandering around trying to get used to Celeste's body.

"I guess I should head back to my... uh, Celeste's room," Makoto thought aloud, remembering that he'd have to stay in Celeste's room for now, since whoever was in his body had the key to his room.

It was a bit worrying that he couldn't figure out who was in his body, but at the very least, whoever it was didn't seem to have any malicious intentions. They didn't want anyone else to die, they just liked his body more than their own, apparently. At least, if they were telling the truth, that is. He couldn't imagine why any of the Ultimate students he'd been locked in here with would prefer his body over their's, and they'd claimed they were one of the boys originally despite not acting like either Hifumi or Mondo. For the time being, though, he decided to trust them. So long as they didn't try to kill anyone, there shouldn't be a problem with them enjoying his body.

Reaching the dorm rooms, Makoto approached the door to Celeste's room and unlocked it. It felt like a breach of privacy, but he didn't really have any other option. He opened the door, and was somewhat caught off guard by what he saw.

"...Where did she get all of this?" he mumbled, looking at the way Celeste's room was decorated. While his room was mostly empty, with only the furniture that had been there when he first arrived at the school, Celeste's room was fully decked out in gothic lolita style. He'd never seen any of this sort of thing around the school, so had it just been here already when they arrived? Was everyone's room decorated like this, and his was just plain because he lacked a talent besides luck? He made a mental note to ask the others later, because if not, then he really wondered where Celeste had found everything being used to decorate her room.

While he wasn't too fond of the style himself, it didn't bother him for the most part, save for the coffin sitting next to the bathroom door. He did his best to ignore it, and stepped into the bathroom. Unlike the rest of the room, the bathroom seemed more or less the same as his, albeit with a lock on the door. He stood in front of the sink, staring into the mirror above it. Even though he'd been walking around in Celeste's body all day, hearing her voice when he spoke, it was still disconcerting to see Celeste's reflection instead of his own, mimicking his every movement. After everything that had happened today, it no longer surprised him, but it still made him uncomfortable.

He had to get used to it, though. He was determined to not let another murder happen, so unless Monokuma got bored and decided this wasn't a good enough motive, he'd be seeing this face every time he looked in the mirror. He did have to admit, thought, that there was a certain amount of irony in him being stuck in Celeste's body. The Ultimate Lucky Student, in the body of the Ultimate Gambler. It'd make for a killer combination, if not for the fact that Celeste's talent wasn't physically linked to her body, and he knew rather little of gambling himself. It made him wonder how exactly Monokuma had decided who got put in whose body. Was it all just random? Did he specifically pick out swaps he thought would be amusing? And for that matter, how was any of this even possible? Everything up until now had been crazy, to say the least, but as far as he'd known, body swapping wasn't a real thing that could happen. And yet, here he was, evidence to the contrary.

He briefly glanced back at the toilet and the shower, before leaving the room. He didn't have to go that badly, and he wasn't about to try and take a shower in someone else's body. As he exited, he heard the familiar sound of the school bell, and the monitor in the room displayed Monokuma's usual night time announcement.

"I should try and get some rest," Makoto said to himself, looking over at the bed. Tomorrow was a new day, and hopefully they'd be able to sort things out then. Celeste's outfit didn't exactly seem appropriate for sleeping in, but he didn't know whether she had any pyjamas around here or not, and he wouldn't feel comfortable getting changed with her body anyway. He did, however, take off her shoes, suddenly realising that he'd somehow been walking around in high heels all day without even noticing. With a sigh, he flicked off the light, and climbed into bed, doing his best to get to sleep.



The night was anything but restful. Makoto had managed to get to sleep, but he still woke up feeling a little tired. He half hoped it was all a dream, and he'd wake up in his own room, in his own body. That was unfortunately not the case, as he woke up to the same sensations he'd been experiencing the previous day. He was still in Celeste's body.

Before he could even crawl out of bed, Monokuma appeared on the monitor for the morning announcement. With a groan, Makoto slowly sat up, rubbing the sleep from his eyes. He was not looking forward to another day of being in Celeste's body. But then, he supposed the alternative was even worse. For him to be back in his own body, for the motive to be over, someone would have to...

He shook his head, Celeste's hair swinging back and forth, as he tried to clear his thoughts. He couldn't let himself think like that. He had to stay hopeful. With that in mind, he pulled himself out of bed and slipped Celeste's shoes back on. Her outfit was a bit wrinkled from him sleeping in it, but he still wasn't ready to get changed. Hopefully Celeste would forgive him for not taking proper care of her body once they all switched back.

Even with everyone swapped like this, Makoto figured it would be best to head to the dining hall, since they had agreed to all have breakfast together. He wasn't sure how many of the others would still be keeping that promise under the current motive, but he decided that he still would be. He just hoped that nothing bad had happened during the night, like the last time he'd slept in someone else's room.

Makoto stood still for a moment, preparing to engage in discussion with the other people who had each divulged their own identity - but then he had another thought. One that might help the group a lot more than simply standing around and talking about what happened.

Sure, many of the members of the group weren't comfortable sharing their identity while they were all together... But what if he asked some of them after the group had split? Maybe some of them would be willing to share if he asked them personally! Or, at least, they wouldn't be fully used to trying to act like the person they were masquerading as, and it would certainly be a lot easier to tell who it was based on their personality ticks. For example, if he talked to Toko right now? He was sure her trademark stutter would come through in a high-tension situation such as this.

Most importantly, he desperately hoped people wouldn't double down on their new identities. What if people later became more comfortable with the idea of becoming the other person, and attempted to take over their new life? That'd be a lot easier to put a stop to earlier than later!

With that in mind, Makoto turned away from the entrance, the drilled locks of hair he now owned swaying in the air from the rotation, and looked at Kyoko and the others.

"Uh... I actually need to go check something, do you mind discussing without me?" Makoto said. It certainly felt odd to hear Celeste's voice without the accent she put on - especially when it was coming from himself. "I'll make sure to come back and answer anything you need!"

"...Yes, that's fine." Kyoko responded after a short pause. "You can ask Taka for the details later."

Taka seemed confused for a moment as to Makoto's intentions, his brow momentarily raising. However, after Kyoko's confirmation, he instead pointed forward, exclaiming, "Yes, that is fine! Be punctual during your return!"

Makoto couldn't help but note that Taka was forcing his voice outwards even more than usual - probably to compensate for his higher pitch and smaller tone, he assumed. At the same time, though, it felt like... He sounded sort of paranoid about something?

No way that's the case... Taka's one of the most self-assuring guys here. He even revealed his identity before anyone else! He's definitely confident he can handle all of this, somehow.

Ignoring those thoughts, Makoto turned around, the clack of his heels resonating throughout the gym's walls.

"Thanks, I'll make sure I see you lat--" Makoto stopped talking as he slipped to the side, almost tripping in his new heels, "...er." Finishing the thought, he finally left the gym.



Outside, Makoto made sure not to leave too long after anyone else. Unless someone was running (which he doubted - it would bring them way too much attention), he doubted there wasn't anyone he couldn't catch up to out of the people who left.

Awkwardly fumbling in his new heels, Makoto edged himself closer towards the wall to keep himself steady. The roughness of the bricked texture definitely felt harsher on his newly sensitive skin, the softness of his own touch distracting him slightly.

"Focus, focus..." Makoto breathed and sighed. If nothing else... At least he was technically a real Ultimate now, right? Although he wasn't sure how well he would do in practice as a Gambler. Maybe that 'Ultimate Luck' he had would supposedly come his way around now?

Either way, Makoto looked forward at the scene in front of him. Some people were clearly walking quite slowly, still figuring out their new comforts and discomforts, while others were changing their clothing entirely to suit their new way of life. For a moment, Makoto thought about taking off some of Celeste's more 'high maintenance' outfit pieces, but he figured it was more than a little bit disrespectful to do it right here. Maybe he would do it once he was back in his (or, well, Celeste's, he supposed) room.

The question was, would Makoto be able to approach someone in time? Or would someone else approach Makoto first, taking advantage of his short period of disorientation to catch him off-guard?

"You..." Makoto suddenly heard a deep voice behind him, causing him to momentarily stumble in his new heels. Before he had a chance to turn around, the person had grabbed him firmly by the wrist, dragging him forcefully to the side of the hallway.

"...Are coming with me." Despite the sudden shock, Makoto thought he could almost make it a voice pattern he recognised in the unknown assailant's speech. Before that, however, he was quickly spun around, made to face his sudden attacker.

"S-Sakura..?" Makoto stuttered out, before realising the mistake he'd made. Even though it looked like Sakura, it obviously wasn't actually Sakura. But then, he wondered, who was it?

"Take a guess." She responded, with a voice that certainly seemed odd to Makoto. Maybe he was hearing things, but that strange accent certainly seemed thicker than anyone else's within the rest of the group. Even with Sakura's deeper voice, it had that same feeling of artificialness that a certain someone else. At least to him, it seemed like the person inside of Sakura's body was...

"...Celeste?" Makoto guessed again, tilting his head to the side and feeling his drill of hair extend downwards in that direction, causing him to need to quickly pull his head upwards.

"Unless I am attempting to bluff you, of course, and this is an elaborate lie crafted to make you believe me... But you, of all people, would never assume that, no?" Celeste candidly responded, still holding on firmly to Makoto's wrist. Even though Makoto's original body was hardly tough, he certainly wasn't used to the daintiness of Celeste's...

"Uh... Celeste? You're hurting my arm a little... Or, your arm?" Makoto pointed his other hand at Celestia's manhandling of her own body, accidentally using the metal finger claw that his new body wore. Despite coming close to poking himself with it, he had to admit - it did look pretty cool.

While her grip slowly loosened, Celeste did not entirely remove her hand from Makoto, keeping a slight amount of pressure on him. "Hm... I am willing to make the bet that you will not run away after I release you. I will say that this different body does allow me to get my way quite a bit easier." After talking, she finally unhanded Makoto, who took the opportunity to dust his frilly sleeve quickly.

"You are simply too honest for your own good..." Celeste pondered out loud, keeping a pristinely graceful pose in spite of her new stature, "Telling everyone that you were in my body? Getting yourself killed while using my face would be more than problematic, no?"

"Well, er..." Makoto faultered for a moment, still not used to talking using Celeste's voice. He almost wanted to put on that fake accent she used just to make it sound even slightly more familiar. Almost. "I didn't really think about it like that. I don't see any reason why anyone would want to kill over someone like this! Nobody would be that dissatisfied with who they really are, right?"

"I have my suspicions about that," Celeste responded swiftly, placing a finger against her chin - a finger that was much larger than she expected, it looked like. "But, adaptability is key to survival, and that is all that matters. Therefore, you shall assist me in doing so."

Makoto recoiled backwards slightly, more than a little alarmed by Celeste's straightforward nature at the moment. "Wait a minute, isn't this the part where you'd manipulate me into doing something bad? Why would you tell me you're Celeste, and not say you're actually Hina, or someone else?"

"Oh? Do you not trust me?" Celeste asked leadingly, leaning forward to (likely) intimidate Makoto with newfound stature.

"It's not that..." Makoto responded, "I believe you're Celeste. I just don't understand why you're telling me that you're actually Celeste."

"Hm. Have you considered that, perhaps, you should not trust me? What if I was someone lying to you? I have given no evidence or proof, yet you believe me. You will assuredly get my body into all sorts of trouble with ideas like that..." She drifted off for a moment, before quickly adding, "Oh, but if you did want to ensure I am myself, I wore my black-spotted lace panties today~"

Blushing at the implication of the statement, Makoto lowered his gaze slightly, "N-No! That's alright, I believe you!"

"Good!" Celeste declared, peaking around the corner once again to ensure that nobody was coming in their direction still. They were still more than far enough away from the gym to be out of earshot of Kyoko, Taka, and the rest. "In that case..."

Makoto looked back up at Celeste: clearly, she already had a plan in mind, something to help herself (and, by extension, Makoto) survive their time in the Killing Game. The issue was, knowing Celeste, there was virtually no way to tell if the request would be a devious plan, an honest proposal, or simply some other request to make of Makoto. Either which way, Makoto feared that he had no choice but to accept in doing whatever it was, for fear of Celeste getting even more physical!

Much to Makoto's surprise, not a single person in the room spoke up. Everyone just eyed each other suspiciously, waiting for someone else to make the first move. Were they just like him, waiting for someone else to go first so they wouldn't be the only one, or were they deliberately hiding who they were, either out of fear or malice? Even Taka, who was normally so bold and had suggested the plan in the first place, seemed to have been shut up, wherever and whoever he was right now. Makoto began to think maybe he should start it off. If no one else was going to do it, perhaps he should be the one to get the ball rolling, so everyone else could follow. But what if they didn't?

Before he could make a decision, Monokuma's laughter filled the gym once more. "Guess I really spooked you with this one, huh? Well, don't worry. If you want your body back, all you've gotta do is kill! And if you wanna keep the body you're in, then hey, you can kill as well! Just kill and kill to your heart's content! Puhuhuhu!" With that, Monokuma fell back behind the little podium he sat on on the stage, and disappeared, leaving a very quiet, jumbled group of students standing in the gym.

Despite not speaking up beforehand, Makoto still felt the need to address the elephant in the room. "S-So, are we, um, really not going to reveal ourselves?" Makoto asked, internally cringing at hearing Hina's voice instead of his own when he spoke. He had a feeling he'd never get used to that. Or any of this, really.

Before Makoto had even finished the question, a few of the other students were already leaving the gym, and those that hadn't yet seemed to be just as anxious about the idea of revealing themselves as Makoto felt.

"Maybe it's for the best that way," whoever was in Chihiro's body said nervously, glancing around at the others in the room.

"Yeah, it'll all make itself clear in time, anyway," Mondo's body added. Makoto had to agree with that sentiment. Aside from those who metaphorically kept their cards close to their chest, like Kyoko or Celeste, he doubted anyone could really hide their true self for too long.

"Alright, I-I guess." Feeling a bit dejected, Makoto slowly joined the group in leaving the gym. He decided he'd back to his room for now, to gather his thoughts and think about his next course of action. No one seemed to be speaking to each other much, besides a small amount of small talk. This motive had truly put everyone on edge, now that no one knew who was who. By the time Makoto made it back to the dorm rooms, he was alone. Everyone else had either split off in another direction, or they'd gotten here before him and had already gone into their own rooms.

Though the walk over wasn't particularly long, it really highlighted the differences between Makoto's body and Hina's. For lack of a better term that Makoto was comfortable using in the current situation, Hina was probably the curviest of the girls remaining in the group, and he, an average boy, just happened to be the one to land in her body. He didn't know whether to call himself lucky or unlucky for that, but right now, he felt incredibly uncomfortable. He could feel Hina's ample chest bounce a little with every step, her hips sway as he walked, and even the emptiness between his legs under Hina's somewhat tight shorts, all serving to throw him off as he walked. At the very least, Hina's outfit was a bit manageable. While most of the other girls wore skirts, and a couple even wore high heels, Hina wore shorts and sneakers. He was thankful for that at least, even if her shorts were a bit too short for his liking.

It was only after Makoto had searched for his room key, finding in Hina's jacket rather than the small pockets of her shorts, that he realised he couldn't use his own room anymore. He no longer had the key, and even then, no one knew he was Makoto. He'd have to use Hina instead. It felt like a bit of an invasion of privacy, but he justified it by telling himself that everyone would be doing it. Upon entering, he found the room to be a bit less sparsely decorated than his, various exercise equipment strewn across the room. Perhaps he should consider keeping up Hina's training regimen, so her body was still in top condition when she got it back?

That was a thought for another time, though, for now, Makoto headed over to the bathroom. He knew what he'd see if he looked in the mirror, but he still felt a need to see his reflection. Just as expected, staring back at him above the sink was Aoi Asahina, the Ultimate Swimming Pro. Every movement he made, his reflection mirrored. There was no denying what he saw.

"This is so surreal," Makoto mumbled, trying to force himself to become accustomed to hearing Hina's voice. He needed to grow used to all of this. He needed to grow used to seeing Hina's reflection, because it was his reflection now, until Monokuma got bored or... for the foreseeable future. There was one hope left, though. Pulling up one of Hina's sleeves a bit, Makoto pinched his arm.

"Ow! Guess it's not a dream, huh?" He should have known. That would have been far too easy. This all felt too real to be a dream, or at least, he assumed so. He'd never been a girl in real life before, so he didn't know whether being one in a dream would feel any different.

"So, what now?" Makoto asked himself, leaning against the sink as he stared into his reflection's eyes. He needed to find some way to fill his time. The motive had been imposed onto them fairly early, so it wasn't as if he could just go back to bed and wait for all of this to be over. Perhaps he should go and find someone to talk to, like he usually did when nothing was happening. He might be able to figure out who people were, and if he could gain someone's trust, then he wouldn't have to go through this all alone. Of course, when just the walk over to the dorm rooms had made Makoto uncomfortable, he wasn't exactly excited about the idea of walking all over the school searching for someone to talk to. Maybe he could just waste time in his room for now. Perhaps he could find a way to get himself more used to Hina's body, preferably without violating her privacy more than was already necessary.

"The beach usually isn't that populated..." Hajime theorised, placing his soft hand on his chin, "If I'm looking for people, the cafeteria's probably a better option. Besides, everyone might go there to have a meeting about this whole thing."

Making his way towards the door, Hajime noted how sluggish Mikan's body felt as he prepared to leave, as if actively pulling against him. Looking down, his protruding chest filling his vision once again, he could immediately tell what exactly it was.

"Damn... Did Mikan not eat at all yesterday? I guess it was pretty early in the morning when we all got swapped - it's not like I went out of my way to eat anything afterwards. Some of Teruteru's cooking would be great right about now." Although, a small inkling in the back of Hajime's mind had him wondering if Teruteru would even be able to cook as usual given the changes. After all, he was in Akane's body, right? Knowing Teruteru, he'd be too busy feeling himself up to do any real work...

But that thought made Hajime realise something. How many people were enjoying their new bodies? As weird as this whole thing was, there were definitely some more... Favourable, so to say, outcomes. For example, getting Nekomaru's body would be an absolute godsend compared to, say, Hiyoko's.

"Or Mikan's..." Hajime found himself mumbling, more than a little bitter about his bad luck. "No, I can't think like that. That's unfair to everyone else - I'm sure we're all going through our own trials right now!" Reaffirming this to himself, Hajime finally took out through the door, making his way towards the cafeteria.



On the way, Hajime inwardly whined to himself every time he moved: his hair uncomfortably bobbed, and his lack of balance (as a result of his new chest) almost caused him to topple forwards several times. Even his stomach made him uncomfortable, as it made a light, feminine growl along the way, demanding some form of sustenance that Hajime didn't have.

"Seriously... Usually, when I'm hungry, I can tough through it. Mikan's body feels like she's gonna collapse." Hajime mumbled to himself again, beginning to notice it as an uncomfortably common habit of his as of late. It was almost like every time he opened his mouth, he couldn't believe the sound that came out - he had to hear it again, just to ensure that it truly wasn't his. Naturally, each time, Mikan's high, squealing voice came out, starting to annoy him to no end.

Despite that, he arrived at the cafeteria, making his way through the entrance. Looking down towards the stairs, he could swear he was hearing some loud commotion going on upstairs - nothing insane, but some loud yelling was definitely going on between people.

"..The HELL?!" He couldn't quite make out who was speaking, due to the distance.
"--The one who..!" The voices flickered in and out, other voices interrupting others. Combined with the distance from the entrance and the upstairs cafeteria, it was difficult to tell who was saying what.
"Why don't you just..!"

As Hajime heard this, he subconsciously took a step backwards, a little shaken. He definitely didn't expect this the moment he walked in - what the Hell should he do?

Well, obviously he knew the answer. He should go up there and try to help out, pacify anyone he can. Now was definitely not the time to be fighting, and plenty of people in the group wouldn't be used to their new strength or weakness. Worst case scenario, someone would get seriously hurt, if not killed!

"But..." Hajime bashfully murmured, looking down at his hand - it was shaking. Even though he knew what to do, he was so... Apprehensive. What if it was something really serious? What if he, himself, got hurt? In Mikan's body, what could he even do? He could barely walk here, with how many times he tripped over himself.

It was hard to admit it, but it was the truth.

Hajime was afraid. Deeply, deeply afraid.

Looking frantically between the stairs and exit, he heard the voices slowly increase in volume. He had to decide whether to help, or simply run away and pretend he didn't hear anything - and fast, before he was caught standing in, looking like even more of an idiot.

"Sonia?" Hajime instinctively uttered, the soft sound of his voice reminding him that this person (while using the appearance of Sonia) was assuredly not Sonia.

"Hmph." Byakuya's near-emotionless tone swiftly responded. "I will pretend that I did not hear that mistake..." The Progeny slowly trailed off as his senses began to pay attention to the new scenery around him. Eyebrow raised, he looked up the stairs towards the sounds of infighting upstairs.

While Byakuya standing with his arms folded and eyebrows raised would normally look quite intimidating and stern, Hajime couldn't help but note how... Uncanny, the pose appeared on Sonia. It was almost like an annoyed mother getting ready to tell off a bunch of children. However, as quickly as those thoughts had gathered, Hajime decided to quickly banish them as the phrase 'Mother Togami' creeped into his head.

"They've barely survived a day... That's disappointing. I had almost hoped they would do better." Byakuya sighed, flicking his new hair over to the side and out of the way of his face.

"A-And... You've been doing alright, Byakuya?" Hajime asked, genuinely curious. He couldn't help but take note of how well-kept the princess clothing Byakuya was wearing appeared to be, despite Byakuya theoretically having no experience in setting up the outfit, as well as the outfit's visible complexity. Would Hajime have even known how to tie the bow on her head?

"Of course. As I am now, I am currently filling the role of 'Ultimate Princess'... Nonsense, if you ask me, but a role I've been given nonetheless." Byakuya readjusted his collar, somehow improving his already immaculately elegant appearance. "And much as I have inherited my family's legacy, I plan to prove that I can inherit another's legacy if that was required of me."

"You're surprisingly calm..." Hajime commented, surprised that he had already taken so well to Sonia's life. Hell, with the right amount of time, he was almost convinced that Byakuya would be able to take it over entirely!

"Maybe so, but even I am annoyed by the aspect of being away from my original body for so long. This short, diminutive stature... It hardly suits me. Either way..." Returning his gaze to the stairs, he began walking in that direction with a firm, deep tone to his footsteps. "Follow me if you plan on helping calm them down. The bright side of being Sonia is that, unlike some of us here, I don't look completely foolish. As such, they should continue to take me seriously to a certain extent, despite the obvious changes."

Hajime looked down in response to that statement, wondering if his facial expression was as pitiful as it appeared earlier in the mirror. Even in this nurse uniform, he looked... Well, ridiculous! How did Mikan wear this thing all the time? Her chest was so apparent, and the bandages around her body just made her look even more weak and vulnerable than she already did. The bizarre hairstyle decision didn't help, either...

Those thoughts racing in his mind, Hajime had to quickly decide as Byakuya approached the staircase. Did he plan on following him up there? Or should he just wait for him to finish, then go up later?

That's right -- he remembered now. This wasn't Nekomaru. It was...

"What the Hell did you just call me, you dumbass?!" Nekomaru's body responded, their fist slamming the door shut on the way in.

"Ah, sorry Hiyoko! I almost forgot with the-" Once more, he was cut off by Hiyoko stomping into the room, angrily staring down at Hajime.

"Y-Y'know I'm also not actually Mikan, right? C'mon, Hiyoko, it's me, Hajime..." Hajime squeaked out, admittedly more than slightly intimidated by Hiyoko's yelling. This was the last person he wanted to see with all the yelling happening upstairs, he had to admit...

"Obviously! What, are you trying to call me stupid now?!" Hiyoko edged her head even further forward, her teeth visibly snarling.

"W-W-W-What?" Hajime couldn't help but stutter in an entirely Mikan-esque manner after such an odd connection. He was entirely thrown off-guard. "N-No, of course not..."

"Then you better say you're sorry!" Hiyoko demanded, her shadow literally casting itself over the top of Hajime's head. "You gross little pig-barf!"

Hajime instinctively stepped back, more than a little frightened. Hiyoko did always enjoy her power trips... Maybe this was her trying to use Nekomaru's body and power to get a bit more of a dramatic reaction from the people around her? Her old body could only manage pranks and the bullying of people who would take it willingly, like Mikan, but with Hiyoko's new body? She could almost definitely exert her will over basically anyone in the group, with natural strength like that.

"I-I'm sorry, Hiyoko. Geez..." Hajime responded, probably sounding more than a little affronted that he needed to apologise for such a minor thing.

"Pft!" Hiyoko breathed, clearly annoyed. "You better say it louder than that!" Hiyoko pushed her arm forward, roughly pushing her finger against Hajime's shoulder. Normally, Hajime wouldn't at all be threatened by anything Hiyoko could do physically, but now? He could feel his legs physically losing balance as the force was barely exerted against him, the puffy cloth on his shoulders collapsing inwards. Resisting the urge to let out a submissive 'eek!', Hajime pooled all of his energy together.

"I said, I'm sorry! I'm sorry I implied you were Nekomaru, and not Hiyoko, alright?" Hajime almost began pleading in response, the high femininity of his voice spilling out as he only increased in desperation.

Hiyoko didn't respond immediately, for once. She seemed to think carefully about something personal, before Hajime eventually saw her next reaction and movement.

12231122.content:
Hajime shook his head in an irritated manner, feeling his hair covering his face again as he did so.

"How does Mikan deal with this..?" He wondered for a moment, brushing the hair back out of the way with his hand. "While I'm stuck like this, maybe I could tie it up, or... Something. Anything to make this a little more normal."

Pushing those thoughts away, Hajime focused back on what he was setting out to do - he supposed that there might be too many people at the cafeteria, given how many are normally there. As sad as it sounded, Hajime didn't entirely feel ready to face most of the group with how he currently was, especially if Hiyoko was doing anything akin to her normal tricks. At least at the beach, there'd probably be fewer people, and he could hopefully work toward becoming a little less uncomfortable with his current situation.



Walking towards the beach, Hajime couldn't help but occasionally itch at his arm, still wondering about those wounds on Mikan's arm. He supposed she was quite clumsy, it was very possible her tripping, or even a medical application mistake, had caused the wounds. Hopefully it wasn't a cause for concern, or anything...

Finally arriving at the beach, Hajime could hear the crashing of the nearby waves, causing him to look curiously out towards the nearby water. He'd never thought about it before, but the ocean was... Surprisingly calming to look at, during times of stress. It was almost as if some of his anxiety was washing away in front of him...

"Hey, Mikan! How's it going?" Chiaki's voice rung out, causing Hajime to turn around confusedly - Chiaki was looking directly at him, while Nagito stood next to them. If he remembered correctly from yesterday, Chiaki and Nagito had swapped, right?

"Um... Nagito, you know I'm not Mikan. It's me, Hajime, remember?" Hajime spoke out, an unavoidable timidness spreading into his voice. Nagito's body also turned around, slowly, and gave a silent wave.

"Ohhh, right! I almost forgot about the swapping thing, haha... Me and Chiaki have just been having fun here!" Nagito (from Chiaki's body) spoke nonchalantly, motioning his hand to the space behind him. Taking a peak beyond the two, Hajime could see a television set up, with a full video game console and multiple controllers wired to it. How did they even get all this stuff wired up on the beach, of all places?

"How did..? Wait, what do you mean you forgot? How can you just forget about all this?" Hajime looked between Nagito and Chiaki, while indicating his arms towards himself.

"It's not that hard, really. Besides, me and Chiaki are more alike than I thought! Well, that's insulting, considering Chiaki is still an Ultimate, without her body or not, while I'm just lowly trash, but... Still, you get used to it!" Nagito stretched out his arms, as if presenting himself to Hajime. Even for Hajime, seeing Chiaki's body doing something like that felt odd - but Chiaki herself barely seemed to care, continuing to play the game on the TV.

"Ugh, I wish I could agree. Mikan's body just feels... Off. Not to mention her hair keeps getting in my face. Honestly, I kind of admire how well you've both taken to this whole thing. Have you both just been hanging out here this entire time?" Hajime asked curiously, continuing to brush his hair out of his face.

"Well..." Nagito's body quietly spoke up, not looking away from the screen, "We started in my room, but Nagito convinced me to go outside... Usami helped set up the console."

"Of course! I've listened to enough of Nekomaru's advice to know how important sunlight is for the body. And I wouldn't want my own bad luck to cause your body to come to harm, Chiaki!" Nagito's stated in an oddly reassuring manner - even Hajime felt how considerate he was being.

"Yeah... I usually prefer to game inside, but this... Isn't so bad." Chiaki spoke softly, keeping her eyes on the screen.

Nagito turned back from looking at Chiaki, facing Hajime once again. "See? There's a lot we can learn from each other. I've been trying to beat Chiaki at Supreme Shatter Bros., but I'm on a losing streak, hahaha..."

Hajime looked at the screen a little closer - Chiaki was performing a lengthy combo on a black sandbag, her male fingers moving with surprising dexterity.

"At first," Chiaki explained, pointing one of her fingers into the air while continuing the combo flawlessly with her other hand. "The sets were nearly even - Nagito's fingers are longer and bonier than mine," Hajime raised an eyebrow at the term 'bonier', but Nagito didn't seem to mind. "...But I eventually adapted. If I was more used to it... Nagito's hands might give me more of an advantage, in theory. It makes it easier to reach the back of the controller, and I can keep my hands a little looser."

Nagito chuckled softly, moving back towards the TV. "Hahahaha! You don't need to compliment me or anything, Chiaki. As it is now, I'm taking at least one stock each set - I bet if you had your original body, I wouldn't even get in a hit!" Nagito rotated his head around, Chiaki's hair slightly moving in front of his eyes - yet, strangely, Nagito didn't seem at all bothered by the inconvenience. His original body did have pretty long hair, maybe he was used to it?

"Hey, Mi-- Sorry, sorry! Hajime, how about you come play some games with us? Usami wants us to socialise, after all. Maybe this'll be what you need to break out that shell you're in?" Nagito spoke as he sat down, working Chiaki's fingers around the game controller.

"You want me to join in..? Well..." Hajime wondered, placing his arm through his hair and on the back of his neck. Playing a game didn't seem so bad right about now, but he did still need to find Mikan. If Nagito and Chiaki had gotten so comfortable just by talking and being friendly, maybe Hajime could do the same by talking to Mikan? It would alleviate some of the anxiety he was sure they were both feeling, at least.

Which should he do?

"Alright, fine. Just a few games though, alright?" Hajime responded, attempting to be as stern as he could with his unimpressive voice - he knew how wrapped up some people got into games, and while he did want to relax for a while, he still had some important things to do.

"That's fine with me! C'mon, Hajime, take a seat next to me, here!" Nagito offered in a jovial manner. As much as Hajime didn't want to notice it, seeing Chiaki's body acting in such a carefree, joyful manner was... Oddly endearing, especially considering how restricted she normally was.

"Who do you main?" Chiaki asked as Hajime slowly began to walk into the area they were all sitting in, "Or... Who are you going to play?"

Fiddling with the bandage around his arm slightly, Hajime wondered the same thing as Chiaki. He'd only played the game a few times at friend's houses - and he remembered winning only a couple times in total. That being said, he at least knew some stuff about the characters... Kind of.

Looking through the roster on-screen, he could see quite a few characters he recognised, as well as some he didn't. Was this a newer version, or was his memory just bad? Either way, he took the third controller sitting on one of the lounge chairs they'd brought with them (it seemed at least one of them had been waiting for other people to arrive) and began moving the cursor around.

Did Mikan's hands always shake this much..? Hajime noted to himself mentally, noticing his own unsteady grip that he couldn't seem to stabilise.

"Uhh... Who do you recommend, Chiaki? I've played a little bit of the game before, but not very well." Hajime asked Chiaki, ignoring his own thoughts. Chiaki also looked at the roster with some deep concentration, taking an occasional glance at Hajime's face. Was she... Trying to compare him to a specific character? Does that work for picking video game characters to play?

"Hmm... Usually, I just tell people to play whatever looks good to them, since it's good to learn the characters before picking one, but..." Given it was Nagito's expressionless face that Chiaki was using for her staring and explanation, Hajime found the whole circumstance mildly uncomfortable, but let it go on anyway. After all, it would be rude to ask her to stop, right?

"You should try Lady Talupena. She's a good all-rounder: strong, but she's also not hard to understand. Her nair and bair are both safe options, so you can just use those when you're being pressured, and..." Chiaki began explaining, before very quickly noticing Hajime's confused expression - probably amplified by Mikan's naturally scared expression.

"Aha! Don't worry Hajime, you'll pick up on the terminology as we go! Let's start the game, alright guys?" Nagito interrupted, picking his own character - Viper. As little as Hajime had played the game, he actually recognised that one, and remembered having an insanely difficult time against his friend who played the same character when he was younger.

Meanwhile, Chiaki already had her character picked out in preparation: a white-donned, red-masked, alternate skin for a character Hajime didn't entirely recognise, called 'Jester'. Given Chiaki was playing them, he naturally assumed that they were a good character. Either way, Hajime was fairly sure he was in for a hard time.



As the game began to load in (once Nagito and Chiaki had finished their back-and-forth over which stage to play on), Hajime tightened his grip around the controller. It was... Surprisingly difficult to get a solid grasp with Mikan's frail hands, he had to admit. That being said, he realised he had to very quickly figure it out, as a missile began hurtling towards him!

"Think fast, Hajime!" Nagito called out, the missile clearly having come from his character as it smashed into Hajime's character, knocking him away.

Damnit... Hajime thought, glancing over to Nagito. Chiaki's face looking so joyfully smug was something he didn't entirely expect, but he didn't have time to think about that. I'm gonna have to adapt soon if I'm not gonna come dead last!

Teleporting back on stage, Hajime retorted against Nagito's attack. While he was still in endlag from his previous attack, Hajime dashed forward and hit Nagito with a dash attack, comboing it quickly by jumping into the air and pressing the A button.

"Well done, Hajime. That wasn't a bad combo, for your first game of the day." Chiaki spoke up in a calm, passive manner. Clearly, she wasn't breaking a sweat - she still didn't have any damage taken.

"I just kind of mashed the buttons, really..." Hajime stated, a little unsure. Still, if he was lucky with his button-mashing, maybe he could at least beat out Nagito?

As Hajime hunched forward, getting more focused into the game, Nagito yelled out, "That's the spirit, Hajime! Just forget about all this real-life stuff and focus on having fun, alright?"

And then something clicked in Hajime - an odd wave of anxiety wrapping him, questions surrounding his mind;

What was he doing playing games when he was stuck as Mikan?
Had Mikan hurt his original body at all?
How could he win the game while stuck in Mikan's body? There's no way he can keep up!
Chiaki and Nagito are probably going easy, to make me feel better...
I can't do anything at all! Not while I'm like this!

A sudden wave of negative thought enrapturing him, he momentarily freezed up, allowing Nagito to get in a Forward Shatter Attack.

"Huh? Are you alright, Hajime? That was an easy dodge!" Hajime looked up, slightly dazed, to see Nagito's concerned expression.

"W-What..? N-No, I'm fine, really." Hajime rubbed his head as he spawned back in, refocusing on what was happen. Still, the rogue thoughts seemed to wrap around his head.

He'd have to try and ignore them, for now... But would he be able to? Every time he tried to ignore the thoughts, they just seemed to come back, with twice the force... What could he do?

"W-Why won't it work? Ah, I'm s-so stupid, I can't even o-open a door right, wahhhh!" Hajime could see his own flustered body trying (and horrifically failing) to turn a key inside the door lock. Placing his face into his palm, Hajime slowly walked up to Mikan - he could feel his knees trembling in sheer embarrassment for her.

"Ahhh! Mik-- I mean, Hajime! I'm Mikan, obviously, I'm sorry! I d-didn't mean to say that! Please forgive meeeee..!" Mikan's terrified attitude certainly did not mix with Hajime's relatively average voice. Sighing tiredly, Hajime placed his frail arms on Mikan's new, comparatively sturdy, shoulders.

"Mikan. Get ahold of yourself, and listen." Hajime's gaze pierced Mikan, as she slowly nodded and stifled a whimper, Hajime's ahoge bouncing as she did so.
"We need to figure something out. You're clearly desperate to get inside, but you have my dorm key, while I have yours. Do you want to swap keys, so we can keep sleeping in our original dorms?" Hajime gave the most reassuring smile he could in his stressed state.

Mikan looked at the key in her hand. "U-Um... Are you sure? Y-Your clothes probably won't fit on you properly now, a-and, um..." She trailed off, but it was clear what she was saying. If they swapped dorms, they'd have their original clothes and tools, but it might be harder to use them in their current bodies.

"A-And..." Mikan spoke up again, sounding more anxious than before. "Usami is doing this s-so we know what it's like to be each other, r-right? Isn't it, ah, in the spirit if we get into our roles as each other?"

Hajime looked at Mikan, an almost incredulous look on his face - what was she suggesting? That they embrace it, and try to fully live the life of the other?

"Mikan, do you know what you're..?" Hajime began speaking before Mikan threw her arms up suddenly in front of her face, and she squealed out,
"Ahh! I-I'm sorry, I shouldn't h-have said that! It's just that, um..."

As she mumbled for a moment, Hajime moved his hand over to his shoulder. Damn! Mikan didn't know her new strength yet - normally whenever she threw her arms up in reflex, it would weakly slap off of whoever was there, but this time she directly hit Hajime's frail shoulder, causing a stinging moment of pain.

"It's just that..." Mikan started again, adding a pitifully high-pitched inflection to Hajime's normal voice, "...All my life, I've been weak, a-and bullied by other people. I want to... I want to know what it's like to be normal, t-to not feel pressured around other people! I, um... Really don't like myself, Hajime: even here, Hiyoko insults me, a-and everyone else feels so much more competent than me... Even if only for a week, I-I feel like I have a chance to not be myself, for once. I-I'm so, so sorry if it's a bother Hajime, but I want to know what that's like. Um... As an apology, I'll let you pick whichever option you want..." And she loosened her grip on the keys, displaying them in front of Hajime.

Admittedly, Hajime was completely shocked - he was almost sure his feminine mouth was wide open at the moment, as he looked at Mikan. Mikan... Really had had a rough life, huh? He didn't know how, but it must've been something. As much as he still wanted to be in the comfort of his own clothes (rather than the stuffy nurse uniform Mikan always wore), Hajime understood Mikan's plight. Maybe... It wouldn't hurt to go along with it? At least for the week?

Looking at the keys, Hajime knew he had an option; demand the keys and enter his room, or let Mikan keep the keys, and help her have the opportunity to feel a little better, for once.

"Mikan, I..." Hajime barely squeaked out, before shortly trailing off. Going silent for a moment, his shoulders relaxed (for what felt like the first time in a while) as he deeply sighed, "I can't believe I'm going with this..."

Pulling out the keys he'd found in Mikan's pockets earlier, Hajime gripped them tightly, and spoke in a confident inflection - one that sounded strange with Mikan's shaky voice, "Okay... So, we'll use each other's rooms and clothes, they'll work better for us right now anyway. We each have free reign to try and live the other's live as best as we can using our new circumstances, okay?"
