"And we can try to teach each other how our lives work, in turn. For example..." Hajime moved forward, wrapping his dainty hand around Mikan's wrist. With some difficulty (Mikan's body seemed to have constantly trembling hands), he guided Mikan's hand over to the lock, and clasped her fingers around the key to the door, "This door has a problem where you need to almost... Flick the key up after you've put it in. Like this! See?" Hajime demonstrated the proper way to open the door to Mikan, then grabbing the handle and opening the door slowly.

"I-I see... So is that why I couldn't get it to o-open?" Mikan asked curiously, seemingly warming up to Hajime a little more now that she had calmed down.

Hajime decided to spare her feelings, momentarily ignoring the fact that Mikan had never actually gotten the key into the lock to begin with. "Yeah, you just need to know the trick, is all. Come on, I can show you around, if you'd like?"

Nodding, Mikan began to take a step inside, and Hajime quickly followed behind.



Surprisingly, Hajime was actually quite impressed with Mikan - she'd successfully gotten inside without tripping, or anything of the like. Looking around, he subconsciously said goodbye to the room, and at the same time wondered to himself what Mikan's dorm looked like, and how it differed to his own.

Walking awkwardly forward, Mikan placed her hand on Hajime's bed: the sensation felt oddly familiar to the touch, as if the body was used to the texture. "S-So, um... Thanks again, Hajime. I-I really appreciate it... Ah, being in a boy's room does feel a little weird, but I g-guess it isn't that different... That's where your bathroom is, and that's where your clothes are, r-right?"

Hajime looked at where Mikan was pointing, nodding with a polite smile. "Yeah, that's right. They'll probably be in the same place in your dorm, since the building's designed the same."

"I-It is a little weird, eheh... My room's a lot more, um... Flashier, in a way? N-Not to say your room is bad, i-in fact it's a lot better than mine!" Mikan started again, before Hajime soon walked over and set next to her.

"I'm sure your room is fine - I'll have to be staying in it, after all. For now, is there anything you need to tell me about yourself? Anything important that I'd rather not find out about until it's too late, or anything?" Hajime conversed calmly, his calm demeanour appearing especially weird on Mikan's face.

"Um... I-I think... I should probably say you have permission to do whatever you like to my body, whether it's for hygiene, fun, or anything else. I'm usually used to saying that to people anyway, eheheh... Ah! But, not if you don't want to, o-of course! I-I'm sorry if that's implying s-something bad about you, Hajime!"

Hajime's smile faltered, as he worriedly looked at his own face, wrinkled in concern. "Mikan... You don't need to feel afraid. If you're scared of who you are and how you act - don't be, because you're not you right now. Just look at me - right now, I'm you, so if it makes you feel better, try thinking about what I would say, and what I would do. Would that make you feel better?" And, Hajime hoped, it would make his body look a little less embarrassing in front of anyone else who saw it. "And, ah, maybe you can get over the whole apologising thing? And maybe stutter a little less? Just as a... Stretch goal, I guess."

Mikan looked at Hajime. For once, her stare was clear, unwavering. Very slowly, she put her arms around Hajime, pulling him into a deep hug - Crap! It was like she had a stranglehold on him! Hajime could barely feel himself as he got squeezed half-to-death and felt his chest press closely against Mikan's. He couldn't quite see Mikan's face, given their heads were now interlocked to the sides each other, but he could feel that she was obviously quite warm.

"N-Nobody's ever..." Mikan stopped herself, loudly clearing her throat, before speaking in a (somewhat) direct, semi-confident manner, "You're really kind, Hajime. I appreciate it a lot. Please, in return, let me show you my dorm as well! You don't need to act like me, of course, but it's good to be prepared, right?"

Patting Mikan on the back, Hajime motioned as if to stand up, but was kept firmly in place by Mikan's grasp. In a hoarse, high-pitched voice, he spluttered, "Y-Yeah... Um... Could you please let go of me, first?"

As quickly as she latched on, Mikan dropped her arms, shuffling backwards, "S-Sorry! I really should be paying more attention - I'm not used to your arms, Hajime. They're a lot stronger than mine were..."

Looking down at his fragile skin, Hajime sighed, "Yeah, I noticed. I'll live with it though, I'm not the pinnacle of human health either. Nekomaru's the type of guy you want to look to for that type of stuff. But I guess his body has Hiyoko in it, now..." Mikan seemed to flush at the mention of Hiyoko's name, and Hajime quickly moved on, "A-Anyway, you said you wanted to show me your dorm, right? You want to do that now?"

Mikan's face lit up, an energised smile coming to her face - Hajime had never seen his own face like that before. Was he really normally so emotionless?
"Yes! That would be amazing! Oh, but, um..." She looked out the window wistfully, "The sun will be setting in a few hours... I get if this has been really tiring for you - my body isn't that energetic, either. M-Maybe you'd rather go to sleep in my dorm, and I'll come see you some time tomorrow?"

"Hmm..." Hajime mumbled to himself, wondering for a moment. Should he go to sleep for now, and follow up with Mikan on the next day, or simply just get the tour finished now, so that they both knew exactly what to do in the future?
1223122.title: Let Her Have The Keys

choices: Don't Bother Asking And Get On With The Tour.
12231221.content:
Hajime lowered his hand, confidently shaking his head. Standing up, he motioned towards the door and stretched his arm out towards it - again, his eyes focused momentarily on the bandages wrapped across him. By sheer instinct, he almost reached his other arm out to tend to that arm, but stopped himself, turning back to Mikan.

"We should get it done before it's too late, I think. For all I know, we might not get the chance to do it tomorrow." Standing next to the door, he moved himself deliberately out of the way, "You want to lead the way, Mikan?"

"Oh! Yes, of course! Um..." Very warily and slowly, she arose from the bed, moving towards the door in front of Hajime, "This way, Hajime!"



Walking them both outside, Mikan began to walk away - but, suddenly, turned around to the door once again.
"Mikan..?" Hajime started, but tapered off as he watched what she was doing. Unveiling the key Hajime had handed her, she locked the door in an uncharacteristically quick motion, and then looked back to Hajime.

"I figured it made sense to lock the door, in case anyone decides to go in, eheh..." She rubbed the back of her head, wiping her hand over Hajime's ahoge, momentarily flattening it before it sprung back up.

"Haha... Good job, Mikan. I almost forgot, myself. Guess that makes you more reliable than me, huh?" Hajime responded with his token patience. Admittedly, he did feel somewhat foolish about forgetting about the door: as much as he didn't think anyone would actually trespass in his dorm, it was just common sense to keep it locked while outside.

"Okay, now that that's done, I'll um... Lead the way!" Mikan exclaimed, emphasizing a manly growl in Hajime's voice. Laughing slightly to himself, Hajime began to follow behind his body, thinking curiously to himself.

Maybe this won't be so bad..? For some reason, seeing Mikan happy... Is a bit infectious. It just makes me want to help her out when I can. I guess, even if I don't have 'fun', or anything, I can at least help Mikan feel a bit better about herself. Maybe--

"Ahh!" Hajime suddenly squeaked out, his thoughts being interrupted as he tripped forward between the floorboards of the wooden pier connecting the dorms together. Loudly clattering his arms on to the floor, he yelped out in pain.

"H-Hajime!" Mikan quickly turned around, reaching her hands down to help him back up, "Are you okay? Not hurt, or anything? I should have some more bandages in my apron pocket if you need them, one second..." She went to reach into one of the pockets on Hajime's clothing, before pulling back, realising her mistake.

"I-It's alright, Mikan, I'm fine. Damn... That hurt more than I thought it would. What type of wood is this?" Slowly getting back up, he brushed his arms, noticing a new bruise scarring his right arm. It seemed Mikan really did injure easily.

"Um... Sorry, that's probably my body's fault - I always had two left feet. Sorry if it's a bother..." Slumping her shoulders, Hajime rested his palm on Mikan's arm, trying to get her attention.

"Hey, it's fine. It's not like it's your fault or anything. Gotta have some confidence, okay?" He winced as a mild flicker of discomfort passed through him, still feeling a bit sore from the fall, "Besides, you still have to show me around your dorm, right? There's no time to be feeling sorry for yourself."

"Right, I understand! I need to respect that you can handle yourself, without blaming myself, or anything." Hajime inwardly sighed in mild frustration towards himself as she said that - admittedly, right now, he actually wouldn't have minded the medical help. But, at the same time, he didn't want Mikan to worry too much, so he let it slide. Hopefully Mikan's dorm had some things to help numb the sensation, even if only slightly. As he wondered to himself, Mikan continued, "So, to the dorm, right?"

"Yeah, sorry for keeping you waiting. I'll be more careful from now on; let's go." Moving behind her, Hajime began towards Mikan's dorm once again, this time keeping an eye on his feet to ensure he didn't trip again. Admittedly, seeing the long, white socks and shoes Mikan always seemed to wear was slightly jarring for Hajime - he'd never worn anything like it, and it still felt strange to see it every now and again.

Approaching the door, Hajime spoke suddenly, "Oh! I have the key right now, don't I? Here, let me get it again..." Reaching into his apron pocket, he unveiled the key he'd been previously searching for - and, as he did so, happened to brush his hand over the syringe he previously poked himself with.

That's right, that syringe... Should I ask Mikan about it? It might be something important. But, then... Would Mikan really just carry something like that around? I don't want to seem like I'm anxious over nothing, or anything. Especially after that fall: it'd just be embarrassing. And if it's something personal, it might be awkward for her to talk about, which I'd rather avoid right now... Should I really even bother asking?
12231221.title: Have Mikan Tour Him Around Her Dorm.

choices: Learn About Nursing From Mikan And Try To Learn What Her Life Is Like.
Come Up With A Different, Fair Compromise.
122312212.content:
I'm sure it's nothing. Besides, I have to be strong for her - if I look like I'm scared, then she'll probably revert back to her normal anxiousness. She doesn't need to fret over me, right?

Clicking the key into the hole, Hajime slowly inched open the door to Mikan's room. Reaching out his other arm, he amicably gestured to the inside, only taking a short glance into the indoors.

"I almost want to say that you should go in first, since it's your dorm, but... Ladies first, right?" Hajime joked, as he watched his original body's mouth curl into a light smile, and lightly chuckle: instead of her normal, effeminate, awkward giggle, Mikan really did sound and look almost identical to Hajime. Her mannerisms were still slightly off, as she rose her hand to her mouth, but she was certainly making progress.

Deciding to not pressure her anymore, Hajime stepped inside the dorm, pulling at the end of the bandage wrapping around his arm. While Hajime didn't find himself too personally interested in the equipment inside the dorm, it was certainly to look at! A wide observation table stretched along the back, while rows of Mikan's identical nurse uniforms lined the sides. Medical equipment was scattered (in what appeared to be a form of controlled chaos) across various tables. Admittedly, Hajime had no idea what any of it was, but it was certainly amazing to look at.

"So... You wouldn't mind staying in here?" Mikan approached from behind Hajime, almost making Hajime jump from surprise. He'd simply been so focused on the room, he must not have noticed her walk in!

"Of course I wouldn't mind! It's... Actually pretty nice, I'd say," Hajime spoke kindly as he looked at some of the medical apparatus. "You'll have to show me around. That's the bathroom over there, right?" Pointing to the same direction that corresponded to the bathroom in his original dorm, Mikan nodded in response.

"Yes! Over there is my wardrobe with all my underclothes, so you can use them whenever you need to!" Hajime was surprised at how confidently chipper Mikan was when talking about a subject like that -- it even made Hajime a little nervous thinking about it. Honestly, he hadn't actually considered the idea that he'd have to bathe and dress as Mikan. Wasn't that kind of an invasion of privacy? But, he supposed, if it made her more comfortable in her new position, then...

"I make sure to bathe and put on a new set of clothes every day - it's good for your hygiene and health, after all. And if there's one thing I know about, it's health! Ahahah..." Mikan continued, later trailing off into a small bit of laughter to herself.

"Yeah, of course. I'll make sure to take care of your body for you, Mikan, don't worry." Hearing the words come from his mouth, Hajime realised how creepy that would probably sound in any other context. Continuing to fiddle with the bandage wrap on his arm, he continued half-jokingly, gesturing to the medical equipment strewn across the room, "But, y'know, I don't think I'll ever learn what any of this stuff does. Seriously, Mikan, you're impressive. You and everyone else here, I feel like I couldn't even imagine being so dedicated to your Ultimate talent. I even forgot what mine was, so I guess I couldn't have been that dedicated to it, right?"

Mikan raised an eyebrow, showing legitimate concern. Was... Was Mikan worrying about Hajime now?

"You shouldn't say that about yourself, Hajime! Whatever your talent is, I'm sure it's just as good as anyone else here. Hey! Um..." She momentarily raised her arm, but stopped herself, clearly thinking about what she was going to say next. While she still wasn't the most sparkling conversationalist, she was certainly improving, Hajime noticed.

"Why don't, ah..." Raising her arm again, she continued, a newfound confidence within her. "Since I'm trying to act more like you, given the opportunity, w-why don't you try and act more like me?" Quickly waving her hands in the air (almost hitting Hajime in the process, as he barely moved out of the way, his hair flowing behind him), realising what she was implying, she went on to explain in further detail, "What I mean is, uh... You're a lot more 'normal' than I am, and I want to know what that's like. Since you don't remember what it's like being an Ultimate... Maybe, if you try to learn a skill or talent, your own might come back to you? And my body has a knack for healthcare and nursing, in a way! I'm sure it wouldn't be that hard to teach you a thing or two - after all, you're really smart, Hajime!" Lightly rubbing her neck - she almost seemed surprised that she could feel it without much hair getting in the way. "And, ah, when you think about it... Most Ultimates are... A l-little eccentric? Maybe reliving that passion and unique way of life might help you remember your past a little more!"

Hajime merely listened, thinking on what Mikan was saying. In any other circumstance, it would honestly be insane. While it didn't sound entirely likely that it would work... Maybe she was right? He thought to himself, this was, quite literally, a once in a lifetime opportunity. Despite the minor chance of it actually working, he considered it.

"So..." Slowly speaking, Hajime's face almost seemed to naturally crease into a meek, innocent look, "What you're saying is, you'd teach me about nursing and that kind of stuff, right? I can't say I've ever had an interest, but..." His gaze went over to the medical equipment. Again, he found himself oddly curious as to what it all was.

"It's fine if you don't want to, of course! Sorry if it's a little sudden, it's just..." Mikan's face dropped slightly as she looked directly down at the ground. "Having someone who understands me, even if just a little bit... Understands what it feels like to be me... I-It really does comfort me a lot, even if it's a little selfish to say... Having you around like this is so, so helpful, Hajime. It's really all I could ever ask for, so it's entirely your choice if you want to do it!"

She looked back up with a passive smile, staring directly at Hajime.

Again, Hajime almost wasn't entirely sure how to respond. Could he even say no to that? It was such an honest, well-intentioned request. Although... Was Hajime really comfortable with spending his time on it? He didn't want to disappoint Mikan. What if he just didn't like anything to do with nursing? If she went through all the effort to teach him, and he failed her, then what? Would they not just be better off with walking around as normal, and talking to the others around the island to try and build confidence? He was fairly certain that learning about nursing would take awhile, but if it made Mikan feel more comfortable... That was essentially his main goal right now, after all. What should he do?
122312212.title: Don't Bother Asking And Get On With The Tour.

choices: Agree To Go To The Beach For Nagito's Event.
Disagree - Hajime Has A Better Idea For What To Do.
1223122121.content:
Hajime's hand reached out to the back of his neck as he thought - in the exact opposite reaction of Mikan, he was surprised by how much hair he had to wade through to reach it. Looking directly at his body, Hajime couldn't help but notice how innocent he looked with Mikan inside of him, almost puppy-like in nature...

"Well..." Hajime lightly began to reply, still thinking the deal through. "I guess, if we've already gone this far... And, I mean, I have all your medical supplies right now. You won't want them, since you're trying to live my life, so someone needs to be able to nurse people back to health if they're hurt, right? I'm sure a lot of us don't know our own strength right now, so it's only fair I do my part."

From what he'd gathered so far, Mikan's life definitely wasn't... Easy. She was physically diminutive, and had probably had a hard time of it. However, if there was one thing that was obvious about her, it was her passion for healthcare. Maybe, just maybe, if she spent time teaching something she was passionate about, they'd be able to form a solid rapport. The better their relationship, the easier Hajime could help her feel a little more satisfied with herself, Hajime hoped.

"So... You'll do it?" Mikan asked, the most earnest inflection in her vocal tone, "...Ah, thank you so much, Hajime! I'll make sure to teach you as best as I can! A-And maybe you'll remember your talent somewhere along the way!"

Mikan clasped her hands in front of her chest in a feminine manner, a beaming smile across her face. At the same time, Hajime couldn't help but note how well Mikan was adapting to Hajime's body; honestly, she'd gotten used to it far better than Hajime had done her's. She already seemed fairly well balanced, and the absence of her normal chest shape didn't seem to off-put her at all.

Maybe Mikan's body is just... Naturally unwieldy, I guess, Hajime wondered to himself, rationalising the difference in adaptation.

"Yeah, don't worry about it!" Hajime replied, giving Mikan the fullest smile he could with Mikan's naturally sad-looking face. "But, for now... It's getting a little late, right? I imagine I'll have to get used to your room, and... Clothes..." He added the last word slightly nervously, but quickly bounced back, "So we'll both probably have to spend some time getting into our new roles, and all. It might be best to split up for tonight and meet back up in the morning so we can keep talking - that way, we can ask any questions we might have after experiencing each other's situations a bit more."

"Oh!" Mikan exclaimed suddenly. "That reminds me, Nagito invited me to a get-together that him and Chiaki are doing tomorrow on the beach... Ah, would you want to come along?"

Hajime raised an eyebrow (likely looking more scared than curious, given Mikan's normal appearance), wondering about that. Nagito scheduling a social event so early seemed a little odd - he wasn't planning to do something weird, right? Then again, it was Nagito. If he was planning something weird, he'd probably just do it rather than undergo some weird, roundabout manner of doing it. Besides, maybe a little gathering would be the best way to get them both comfortable in their new bodies?
1223122121.title: Learning From Mikan.

choices: Agree To Pretend To Be Mikan.
Refuse To Act Like Her, But Still Say You've Both Swapped Back.
1223122122.content:
Hajime hated to do this. Mikan's eyes seemed so wide and full of hope, clearly delighted at the idea of teaching someone else about nursing. Maybe it was her dream to have a student of her own to teach everything she knew? Either way, Hajime didn't want to disappoint her - the simple fact was, he didn't really have any interest in healthcare. On top of that, he didn't want to disappoint Mikan by being unable to keep up with anything she talked about.

"Ahaha, thanks for calling me smart Mikan, but..." As he continued, he noticed the clear drop in Mikan's expression. A pang of guilt crossed him as it became clear she knew what was coming next, despite his attempt to let her down softly.

Damnit! How does she make my face look so... Cute? I almost feel like I can't deny her...

In spite of his thoughts, Hajime continued, "I don't know if I really have the knack for nursing, especially not to the extent of someone like you. I wouldn't want to disappoint you by not being able to keep up, or anything..."

Hajime moved his head over to the side for a moment, looking at Mikan's various supplies she had in her room. Well, now his room, he supposed. He'd have to get used to these walls for the next week or so, very soon.

However, as he looked back to Mikan's face, removing his attention from the walls of the room, he noticed how truly crestfallen she looked. Despite that, she was clearly trying to hide it.

"Um... T-That's fine, Hajime! Aha... I understand why you'd say that... I'm sure it'd be a lot of work for you, a-and I definitely wouldn't be the best t-teacher, so..." Hajime's body bashfully stumbled out, the sound of Mikan's disappointment permeating through the manlier vocal sound of Hajime's body.

To be frank, Hajime felt awful. He had no idea it meant that much to her! However, no matter which way he sliced it in his mind, he couldn't see something like nursing lessons working out too well in the future, especially if he had no passion for it. Still, that didn't mean they couldn't come up with a compromise!

"B-But, Mikan! That doesn't mean we can't come up with something else! After all, there are other things I could do, like..." Hajime struggled to come up with something immediately, but he could see Mikan lightly brushing a finger against her eyelid. Clearly, she'd held back from crying so that Hajime wouldn't have to see his own body acting like that.

"Um..." Mikan mumbled, slowly picking up her voice. "I-I guess, if the problem would be that you don't have any real passion for it - which I completely understand! - I wouldn't want you to do it... It'd probably move you further from remembering your talent, than anything." She stopped for a moment, placing the tips of her fingers on her temple, thinking about something, "After all, I-I don't want to be selfish! I want to make sure we can both get some help for our problems, so..."

Hajime was silent, not wanting to interrupt her thinking. Admittedly, it was a little odd seeing such a serious expression on his face coupled with Mikan's timid speaking patterns.

"Maybe we could, um..." Mikan began to suggest something, but faded off again, biting her lower lip.

"You know, Mikan..." Hajime quickly interjected, wanting to comfort her as much as possible. It was clear she was feeling guilty about herself - which, Hajime thought, was completely unfair. "Usami set this whole thing up to help us understand each other better. While I think she could've made a better plan to do it, that's the intention. So, if you want to suggest we do something slightly weird, or 'out-there', that's totally fine with me. The only reason I'm saying no to the lessons is because, well..." Rubbing his hand against his bandaged arm, he felt the material rub softly against him, "...I just don't want to disappoint you. If I did that, I wouldn't be able to forgive myself -- anything else, though, and I'll definitely help you out!"

Once again, Hajime gave the most confident smile he could, Mikan following along in response.

"Thanks, Hajime..." Mikan began replying, her tense shoulders visibly relaxing slightly.
"You're so nice, it's a shame we didn't talk more before all this..." As she spoke, she slowed down, repeating the end of her sentence again, "Before all this, huh..?"

Hajime tilted his head to the side - a large swathe of hair following him and almost tipping him completely over. It seemed as if Mikan had come up with something.

"What if, ah... This is going to sound a little strange," Mikan stared at Hajime directly in the eyes, an incredibly honest look on her face. "Everything's so... Confusing right now. Not just for us, but for everyone else, and I think everyone wants something, or someone to help them. And, as the Ultimate Nurse... Well, I-I think that should be my responsibility!" She spoke, trying to pump her arms confidently in front of her. "But, I think even if I act like you, people will know it's me deep down. They'll think less of me, because of how clumsy I am. E-Especially Hiyoko..."

Hajime looked down. While he didn't like to admit it, Hiyoko definitely had it out for Mikan in particular. Whether or not she'd done anything wrong, the baby-faced dancer always seemed to have some biting retort or insult.

"And that's why it might be a good idea to, well... Lie." Mikan finally got to her point, and then suddenly took another deep breath, continuing, "T-To help everyone! Maybe we should tell everyone that Usami didn't swap us, or that she swapped us back, and then we both act like each other in front of everyone! It'll let you feel what it's like to live like an Ultimate without needing to go through the trouble of learning all that nursing stuff, a-and I can try to interact more with the others in your body. It helps me be a lot more confident, a-and they won't think less of me because of what I've done before..."

Hajime's eyes widened as Mikan continued, sternly folding his two bandaged arms around each other. As... Honestly weird and bizarre as it all sounded, he had to admit he saw the merit. Specifically, For Mikan. Hajime was absolutely sure that the chance to live as someone else, for Mikan, was one of the best experiences she'd ever gained, and everything she wanted to do fell in-line with what Usami wanted from them.

Even then... I'd have to act like Mikan, and vice versa. I don't think it'd be that hard, but I'd have to be decently convincing, otherwise it'd ruin Mikan's idea of wanting to help people without them knowing it's her...

Hajime thought to himself. This definitely wasn't a decision to be taken lightly: he'd have to change his entire demeanour if he agreed. That being said, they'd already come this far, and it felt so difficult to deny Mikan her wishes. They were honest enough, after all, right? In an almost selfish way of his own, Hajime couldn't help but admit that he, too, was curious about what living like someone else was like. After seeing how well Mikan had adapted to his body, he almost wanted to do the same thing, just to prove that he could mimic that level of resilience and fortitude.

"Mikan, I..." Hajime began to reply, Mikan's eyes lighting up once again.

"Alright, let's do this" Hajime replied.

"Oh my g-g-g-gosh!!" exclaimed Mikan, "Thank you oh so much Hajime!! You have no idea how grateful I am to y-y-you. You're doing me a great favour and I don't know how I'd ever r-r-repay you."

"Well" said Hajime, "for what it's worth, I really want to try living like an actual Ultimate. I'll finally have something to be confident about. Even if..well..I don't actually have a talent, but still..."

"It's fine Hajime. I c-c-completely understand what you mean!!" replied Mikan.

"Y'know, Mikan, I don't stutter a lot. You're going to have to get rid of that", said Hajime.

"Of course Hajime!"

"Thanks, should we go to the restaurant? I'm really nervous to do this, but I'm sure the others are waiting for us."

"Yeah, let's go" replied Mikan.

With anxious footsteps, both of them left Mikan's room.
12231221221.title: Agree To Pretend To Be Mikan.

Hajime and Mikan left the cottage and made it to the restaurant, where everybody was waiting. It was a really bizarre sight watching people's bodies do what they normally wouldn't do.

"Ah, Hajime, Mikan, good morning!" said Nagito, who was in Chiaki's body, "How's your swap going?"

"Me and H.. I mean Mikan, got our bodies switched back last night. I don't know how or why, but it seems we're no longer in our bodies."

"THERE'S NOTHING WRONG WOTH MY BODY" bellowed the loud voice of Nekomaru, who was actually Hiyoko. "But still, why does THAT trashy, skanky pigshit get her own body back but I DON'T?!"

"Trashy skanky pigshit?!" whined Hajime. "Why are you always s-s-so mean to me, Hiyoko?"

Before the nightmare continued, Shuichi, possibly as a side effect of the change, plunged back into a deep sleep in which he could temporarily stop thinking about what had just happened. He, of course, had no idea that his little adventure was going to continue very soon.



----



The young detective's body (or at least the one he was using) managed to wake up before his mind: his thoughts had been totally disordered because of what he had just felt, so he had not yet fully realized that he was awake. That was the only anesthetic that kept him from losing his cool immediately.

Was it all...a mere dream? was the only thought that Shuichi managed to create. He vaguely remembered having manifested a radical change in the gym, but his memory was so fragile, brief and imprecise that he was unable to give it importance at first. The Ultimate Detective, assuming such an event was impossible and absurd, quickly moved to devote his efforts to bringing his mind back to reality.

And once he did, the apocalypse began.

Shuichi began to feel exactly the same as in the dream, but this time it lasted so long that he could no longer blame his subconscious. Now that nothing could interrupt him, the young man began to notice and differentiate absolutely all the alterations that he seemed to have suffered: graceful and long bangs blocked one of his eyes, he could swear that he was wearing a dress in addition to gloves and a head accessory, without mentioning that...there was something indescribable on his chest.

Once he understood what all that meant, he desperately jumped out of bed with a strength, speed and flexibility that seemed superhuman to him. However, discovering that he had done it with a limbs that were identical to Kirumi's and that he was wearing her servant uniform on top of it disturbed him much more. In the end, he couldn't take the pressure anymore and ran to the bathroom of his room.

He had always despised himself for being afraid of the truth, but not even the most biased human being in the world could easily deny the reality that was presented to Shuichi's eyes: Kirumi, the precious and elegant Ultimate Maid, was staring back at him through the mirror. Her shadowed eyes reflected a deadly panic that covered her entire face, causing her mouth to open until it formed an O.

Despite everything, a part of Shuichi wanted to take his eyes off the reflection and try to forget everything. Taking over Kirumi's physical existence sounded so painfully unreal and fictional that Shuichi still hadn't fully accepted it. After all, that would imply that, in a way, Shuichi was no longer himself.

That is why he needed to prove to himself that he really could decide the maid's actions and make her act in a way that was very unlike her in order to believe it. It was probably because Shuichi was exhausted and unconsciously wanted to ease the atmosphere, but he ended up doing something so childish that for a moment it seemed to be Kokichi who controlled her body, not him.

“I’m Kirumi Tojo, the Ultimate Mom. My sole purpose is raising everyone and making sure they become exemplary adults” Kirumi said.



----



After spending twenty minutes resisting the urge to run around in circles, the now detective maid managed to stop her breathing from being as fast as the blue hedgehog Monokuma claimed to hate and remembered that she was not the only one that had ended up in another body. The most logical option, therefore, would be to leave the room that had witnessed her panic in order to meet the others.

Shuichi wouldn't have admitted it, but he did it partially because he wanted to check who had ended up in his body. The last thing he wanted to see at the time was his own body being controlled by someone who loved the femininity of her original body way too much…or by someone who loved pranks.
